displaytitle: Lot and His Daughters Leaving Sodom
dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 34.3 × 40.4 cm (13 1/2 × 15 7/8 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: Collector stamp in purple ink, verso lower left: R. Peltzer (Lugt 2231)
inscribed:
Signed and inscribed in plate, loewr left corner: Antonius Bloclandt inuent.. / Henricus Goltzius sculp.. et excude / gedruckt tot Haerlem.  

Date at lower left of center: Ao 1582

Six lines of Latin in three columns in margin: NE IVSTVS PEREAT ... POENA CRVENTA TRAHAT.

titles.title: Lot and His Daughters Leaving Sodom

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Rudolf Peltzer [1825-1910, Lugt 2231]; sale of the collections of Rudolf Peltzer, Grégoire Stroganoff, and Friedrich Schindler, Stuttgart, May 2, 1913, lot 587; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
